At this point, I think they're basically two versions of the same story about a boy and his clinically depressed sister.
"She Used to Be Cool" is the light-hearted romantic version
"We Used to Be Happy" is the grounded tragic drama version
Like I couldn't even keep it up it dehornied me with wholesome.
No longer horny just happy

Part 1 ends with dark vibes, the sister seems to have developed mental issues and going down the rabbit hole but Part 2 goes to a more uplifting route. I have to say that I like this artist more for his unique pacing and relatively grounded stories than his sex scenes.

If I were stubborn enough, I would say the slight difference in the hair could be due to the different time periods and them changing their hair style a little/cutting it maybe. Or it could be the difference in his ability to draw the hair like before as the original japanese versions were made i think a year or two apart. The different stories were very easy to connect and i’m sure at least a couple other people have made a similar mistake as I have. Anyways, thank you all for correcting my mistakes and enlightening me. Though the two stories are not the same, nor are they connected, I personally still enjoy thinking that they are one story even if they are not, and honestly I probably will continue to play with that idea if i ever reread this once again.

You guys have brought up great points, and honestly, I realize they are in fact, two different stories. After checking the authors other works he does in fact name them similarly, the designs of the characters are also quite similar for a lot of them and only the color of the hair will change, in this case the 2 seemed to have very similar hair colors in the cover with only a slightly noticeable distinction between the two after analyzing it more closely. I definitely saw some very close similarities between these two stories specifically unlike the others which I believe is what really made the connection in my mind that the two were the same story just during different time periods. The similarities in the parents designs as well most likely tripped me up and i most likely misread the names while reading them. I think it's very easy to accidentally mistake the two for being one story if you (as i have) have not read the other works of the author or if they just were not as memorable.
These kind of doujin is only serve the plot. Not for fap.

Now, "We Used to Be Happy" is a prequel to "She Used to Be Cool"?

I don't think so...

-The design of some characters do not match and are obviously different in the respective works.

-The name of the protagonist boys are different, in "WUBH" the boy's name is Yuuya and in "SUBC" it's Yuuta

The story of the two works doesn't fit together unless they are "reworked" a little bit to fit together.

For people who think that "We Used to Be Happy 1/2" is a sequel to "She Used to Be Cool 1/2", it doesn't make sense, I'll explain why:

-At the end of "She Used to Be Cool" it is mentioned that Yuuta (the boy) and Sis (the girl) are not blood brothers. 

- besides having their parents' blessing, they are going to get married in the future.

There is no reason that, already having such a strong relationship, there is so much distance between them as it turns out to be in "We Used to Be Happy".

In „Older sister and complaint little brother“ the doujins series that was published before these the little brother is named Yuuma. The author just names them pretty similar and makes similar storylines.
@carcass believe me 95% of those reading this story are more interested in the story than nut, thanks for the explanation
Well that…..tookam turn
Thanks @carcass my man I was confused, awesome analysis
@Carcass Thank you so much. Appreciate it🙇

Also, the mother in “She used to be cool” is worried that yuuya will follow his sisters route (end up without a job and mental problems” though in “We used to be happy” the mother is under the impression that the sister is fine (the mother suspected something at first but was assured she was fine and left after she “put up an act” when the parents came to check in on her”). If the mother hadn’t known about his sisters poor mental condition she would not have been worried about yuuya’s mental condition due to the expectations of her (the mom) and the father as they would have no reason to believe that their expectations would lead to any problems. In other words,  we can confirm (if anyone needed) that the sister is actually better now and she didn’t get worse during “we used to be happy”. I’m not sure if anyone really cares about the lore or if they were confused but i was and i definitely needed to make sure things turned out well.

During “She used to be cool”, yuuya already knows she has some sort of mental problem or at least has changed greatly when he mentions “That’s probably what she would say…” “If she was the sister she used to be”. During “We used to be happy” he only assumed she was going to kill herself, insinuating that he was unsure if she suffered from any mental problem such as depression. He also questions in “She used to be cool” about wanting to help her/give her a reason to live, whereas once again, he was only assuming based on his mothers words that she was going to kill herself. He relates that to a movie and thus is why he travels to her house thinking she’s going to kill herself. Also if "We used to be happy" was the continuation of "She used to be cool" they would have been married, though they were not. They vow in "she used to be cool" to get married while in the bathtub though they aren't married in "We used to be happy".
No incest, very sad.

So "We used to be happy 1/2" is set in the past. "She used to be cool 1/2" is what's currently going on. We can figure this out by the fact that she is still working during "We used to be happy 1/2" as she still got calls from work, and they talked about resigning. In "She used to be cool" She is no longer working and the brother referred to her as useless (not in a rude way just to explain the situation i believe). If she was working she would not be useless. There is also a little piece of text that says "You're cosplaying as your old self" when the sister cosplayed in her school girl outfit. This means that she isn't a student anymore, and before she had a job she had to have been a student, thus also proving that this is the current situation. It is also noted that yuuya was surprised and not so upfront about sex when he saw his sister nude during "We used to be happy" but in She used to be cool he goes to her room and asks her to strip without much hesitation.

Mom agrees because not blood related. Brother decides to become successful for her sake with plans to get married together. Only then does he find out theyre not blood related. They go back to therapist that did nothing and he ends up giving brother a recommendation to a lab research university because he accepted his neet sister and didn't force her to change?

Wow translation was pretty good for the most part and actually got me to understand this story better. I love it. This left me feeling a bit sentimental for the sister and in the end, that wholesome feeling of satisfaction and happiness from the main characters is so sweet. This has got the characters enough space to develop from start to finish, absolutely fantastic. I loved the art too. It was clean, simple, expressive. Overall, one of a kind masterpiece.

That was soooo wholesome, bro. Didn't fap, but I'm satisfied.

That doctor though... Suspicious. I hope nothing bad happens to our cute couple.

Now for some critique. I think the overall of the story is pretty good. In the sense that the brother decisively made decisions that would help lessen the burden on his sister's back or at least what he thought would be good for his sister. The support he provided at the begining of the story is definitely the pivotal point to the start of their peculiar relationship.
good shit
This was so wholesome that I never got a complete wood.
She got emotional support, leading to her having the fuel to let her mind heal. Huge win that she's adopted. Wholesome as heck, 10/10. Its enough to make a grown man cry, and thats ok.

The therapist/Doctor for sure raped her at some point. Anyway, I still believe that she tried to commit suicide at some point before the story began since that's the only thing that would neatly explain everything. Regardless, it was a well written story and I was strangely proud that MC decisively told the therapist/Doctor to fuck off at the end. That guy was hella shady from the beginning and in any other story, he'd be NTR'ing the kid for sure.... but yeah although it has some minor issues, this is some  of the best content I've encountered here.

Been a big fan of nakani for a while and i like how the faces for his characters are actually realistic. The faces really convey the character's emotions, like the famous sex faces he draws. The characters give off that feeling that they're in pure bliss and at the same time speechless. The characters just want to savour the moment persay. And the facial expressions for the girl at the first chapter, you could already see how lifeless she looks without looking too cartoonish/exaggerated. Not a lot of artists can do this tbh salute to nakani.
